meanings.definition: The art or technique of using multiple colors in a work of art.
meanings.sent1: The artist's polychromy in the painting brought the scene to life.
meanings.sent2: The polychromy of the mural made it stand out among the other artworks.
meanings.sent3: The polychromy of the painting made it seem like a rainbow had melted onto the canvas.
meanings.sent4: Her use of polychromy was like a symphony of colors dancing across the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The polychromy of the masterpiece was so vibrant that it seemed to jump off the wall.

meanings.definition: The quality of being brightly colored or multicolored.
meanings.sent1: The garden was a polychromy of flowers in full bloom.
meanings.sent2: The polychromy of the butterfly's wings was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The room was a polychromy of mismatched colors that somehow worked together.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a polychromy of reds, oranges, and purples.
meanings.sent5: The polychromy of the peacock's feathers was a sight to behold.
